Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Molecular dynamic ( MD ) simulations showed that the overall effect of the mutation p . Val204Asp is disruption of hydrogen bonding between Gln223 and Glu441 , leading Ser198 and His438 to move away from each other with subsequent disruption of the catalytic triad functionality regardless of the type of substrate .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| p . Val204Asp |
| Gln223 |
| Glu441 |
| Ser198 |
| His438 |
| catalytic triad |

Note: I'm assuming that "p . Val204Asp" is a chemical entity representing a mutation of the amino acid valine (Val) at position 204 to aspartic acid (Asp) in a protein. "catalytic triad" is a common functional group in enzymes, so I included it as a chemical entity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| p . Val204Asp |
| Gln223 |
| Glu441 |
| Ser198 |
| His438 |

Note: I have removed "catalytic triad" from the list as it is not a specific chemical entity, but rather a general term for a common functional group in enzymes.
